Crimes.Legal_Issue: Exclusion under Article 1F(b) of the Refugee Convention
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA), Article 1F(b) of the 1951 Refugee Convention
Crimes.Application_Facts: Male applicant previously deported from the USA, illegally re-entered after serving a 27-month sentence for drug trafficking
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of Refugee Protection Division decision
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Applicant for refugee status in Canada
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Illegal re-entry into the United States following deportation
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of persecution in country of origin
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Nature and severity of prior conviction, intent to evade immigration laws
Crimes.Applicable_Legislation: IRPA, sections related to inadmissibility and refugee eligibility
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Standard of review on judicial review
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Not central; exclusion based on criminal inadmissibility
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Conviction record, immigration history, sentencing documents
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Individuals with serious non-political crimes are excluded from refugee protection
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: N/A for male applicant; female applicant lacked evidence of ongoing threats
Crimes.Decisional_Body: Refugee Protection Division, Federal Court on review
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Risk of return to country of origin not considered due to exclusion
Crimes.Cause_Description: Applicants sought refugee status but were barred due to criminal history and insufficient evidence
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Official records accepted as proof of conviction and deportation
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: U.S. immigration law on re-entry after removal
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: None raised regarding authenticity of conviction records
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Violation of lawful residency requirements in the USA
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Canadian refugee determination jurisdiction over foreign nationals with U.S. convictions
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Conviction deemed final and serious under Canadian standards
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Conviction for drug trafficking constitutes a serious non-political crime
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Female applicant failed to provide documentary evidence of threats

Crimes.Crime_Name: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act violations
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Exclusion under Article 1F(b) and credibility of fear of persecution
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, Article 1F(b) of the Refugee Convention
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Evaluation of subjective fear and objective evidence of persecution
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicants to establish well-founded fear of persecution
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Female applicant returned to Colombia, undermining claimed fear
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Article 1F(b) excludes those with serious non-political crimes
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Persecution by non-state actors in Colombia
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Proceedings found fair and compliant with natural justice
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: Conviction record, travel history, lack of documentation of threats
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Board misapplied legal standard or ignored evidence
Crimes.Defendant_Response: Claimed fear of persecution despite criminal history
Crimes.Resolution_Mechanism: Administrative hearing followed by judicial review
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Serious non-political crime, lack of credible fear
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Seriousness of crime assessed based on Canadian equivalents

Crimes.Crime_Name: Possession of cocaine for the purpose of trafficking
Crimes.Dispute_Type: Refugee ineligibility due to criminal conduct
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Application of Article 1F(b) exclusion for serious non-political crime
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Conviction for intent to distribute cocaine in the USA
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to rebut presumption of seriousness
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Criminal conduct undermines claim of persecution
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Article 1F(b) bars refugee status for serious non-political crimes
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Whether Board properly applied legal test
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: U.S. conviction record, sentence length, nature of offense
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Conviction not equivalent to serious crime in Canada
Crimes.Defendant_Response: Claimed political motivation, but crime was non-political
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Presumption of seriousness applies unless rebutted

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Refugee exclusion based on criminal activity
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Issue: Right to fair hearing before IRB
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Gravity of offense, sentence length, aggravating factors
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issue: No dispute over authenticity of U.S. conviction
Crimes.Procedural_Requirement: Opportunity to respond to exclusion grounds
Crimes.Risk_Nexus: No nexus between crime and persecution claim
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Serious non-political crime under international law
Crimes.Basis_for_Decision: Conviction for conspiracy to traffic drugs
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Not determinative; exclusion based on crime
Crimes.Risk_Persecution: Claimed but not substantiated due to exclusion
Crimes.Mode_of_Entry: Irregular entry into Canada after U.S. deportation
Crimes.Relevant_Factors_Considered: Nature of crime, penalty, trial fairness, deportation history
